document.docAuthor: Datta, Tridip Kumar, Navarrete, Alberto De Jesus & Mohapatra, Anil
document.masterDocTitle: Rhynchonema dighaensis sp. nov. (Monhysterida: Xyalidae): a marine nematode from the Indian coast with an illustrated guide and modified key for species of Rhynchonema Cobb, 1920

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Rhynchonema dighaensis sp. nov. (Monhysterida: Xyalidae): a marine nematode from the Indian coast with an illustrated guide and modified key for species of Rhynchonema Cobb, 1920

subSubSection.paragraph: Buccal cavity in two parts, short anterior chamber at level of cephalic sensilla, narrow tubular part at least 25 µm long. Amphid placed over or very close to end of buccal tube. Male with two testes.

Type species:
Rhynchonema cinctum
Cobb, 1920

Valid species of
Rhynchonema
along with their type locality and habitat (
Fig. 2
).

Updated from
Lorenzen 1975
and
Bezerra et al. 2014
.

Rhynchonema amakusanum
Aryuthaka, 1989
: Amakusa, Japan ; intertidal zone and adjacent seagrass (
Zostera marina Linnaeus, 1753
) bed.

Rhynchonema ambianorum
Boucher, 1974
: Atlantic coast of France ; fine sand from 5 m depth.

Rhynchonema brevituba Gerlach, 1953
: Italy ; sandy beach.

Rhynchonema cemae
Bezerra et al. 2014
: Olinda’s Isthmus, Pernambuco, Brazil ; intertidal medium sand.

Rhynchonema ceramotos
Boucher, 1974
: Atlantic coast of France ; fine sand from 5 meter depth.

Rhynchonema chiloense
Lorenzen, 1975
: South Chile ; sand in the tidal area.

Rhynchonema cinctum
Cobb, 1920
: Salaverry, Peru ; near low water line.

Rhynchonema collare
Nicholas and Stewart, 1995
: New South Wales , Australia ; sandy ocean beaches.

Rhynchonema deconincki
Vitiello, 1967
: Atlantic coast of France ; arenicola sand.

Rhynchonema dighaensis
sp. nov.
: Digha, West Bengal, Northern part of east coast of India . Study area is influenced by several fresh water inflows.(Present paper).

Rhynchonema dispar
Gourbault, 1982
: Guadeloupe , West Indies; sandy beach.

Rhynchonema falciferum
Boucher, 1974
: Atlantic coast of France ; fine sand from 5 m depth.

Rhynchonema fossum
Lorenzen, 1975
: Santa Marta , Atlantic coast of Columbia , Southern Chile ; steeper surf beach, at the top of outgoing waves, 5-10 m depth.

Rhynchonema gerlachi
Vitiello, 1967
: Europa Island, Mozambique Channel, Madagascar ; marine sand.

Rhynchonema hirsutum (
Hopper, 1961
)
: Alabama, Atlantic Coast of USA , Gulf of Mexico ; fine sand from 5 m depth.

Rhynchonema impar
Lorenzen, 1975
: Santa Marta , Atlantic coast of Columbia , Southern Chile ; steeper surf beach, at the top of outgoing waves, 5-10 m depth.

Rhynchonema kikuchii
Aryuthaka, 1989
: Amakusa Shimoshima Island, Japan ; intertidal zone and adjacent seagrass (
Zostera marina Linnaeus, 1753
) bed.

Rhynchonema longituba Gerlach, 1953
: Italy ; marine sandy beach.

Rhynchonema megamphidum
Boucher, 1974
: Atlantic coast of France ; fine sand from 5 m depth.

Rhynchonema moorea
Boucher, 1974
: Society Island, Moorea Lagoon, Central Pacific; littoral coral sand.

Rhynchonema ornatum
Lorenzen, 1975
: Atlantic coast of Columbia ; exposed sandy beach.

Rhynchonema quemer
Boucher, 1974
: Atlantic coast of France ; fine sand from 5 m depth.

Rhynchonema scutatum
Lorenzen, 1972
: Southern North Sea; fine sand from a depth of
25 m .

Rhynchonema semiserratum
Lorenzen, 1975
: Pelluco at Puerto Montt, Southern Chile ; extensive coarse sad flats near low water line.

Rhynchonema separatum
Lorenzen, 1975
: Chiloe Island, Sothern Chile ; coarse sand beach in the lowest tide range.

Rhynchonema sieverti
Gourbault, 1982
: Guadeloupe , West Indies; coral sand.

Rhynchonema subsetosum
Murphy, 1964
: Oregon, Pacific coast of USA ; sand from mid tide region.

Rhynchonema tomakinense
Nicholas and Stewart, 1995
: New South Wales , Australia ; sandy ocean beaches.

Rhynchonema tremendum
Lorenzen, 1975
: Chiloé Island, Southern Chile ; coarse sand near the low water line from a depth of 10–20 cm .

Rhynchonema veronicae
Bezerra et al. 2014
: Olinda’s Isthmus, Pernambuco, Brazil ; intertidal medium sand.

Rhynchonema xiamenensis
Huang & Liu, 2002
: Xiamen Island, Fujian, China ; low intertidal sandy beach.
